entities.description: A specific part or section of the survey, such as risk/availability.
Type of substance used, such as LSD, heroin, or cocaine.
Frequency of substance use, such as once or twice, weekly, or monthly.
The perceived risk of harm from using substances.
Participant's responses to survey questions, indicating their perception of risk.

relationships.description: Indicates that the survey response is part of a specific section of the survey.
Connects the survey response to a specific type of substance.
Connects the survey response to the frequency of substance use.
Indicates the respondent's perception of risk or harm from substance use.
